required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Bonviva (Ibandronate) and Alendronate on Renal Function in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis at High Risk for Renal Disease.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open Label Study Evaluating the Effect on Renal Function of Intravenous Bonviva Given by Injection or Infusion, Compared With Oral Alendronate, in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis at High Risk for Renal Disease.

brief_summary.textblock: This 3 arm study will evaluate renal safety after administration of an intravenous (iv) injection or infusion of Bonviva, compared to oral alendronate, in patients with postmenopausal osteoporosis, at increased risk of renal disease. Patients will be randomized to receive Bonviva 3mg intravenous (iv) by a) injection or b) infusion once every 3 months, or alendronate 70mg per oral (po) weekly. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is 500+ individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Actual Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) (Using Abbreviated Modification of Diet in Renal Disease [MDRD] Formula)
primary_outcome.description: The primary parameter of the study was the change (mL/min) from baseline in actual GFR (abbreviated MDRD formula using the patients' actual body surface area) after 9 months (or 40 weeks) of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Actual GFR (Using Cockcroft-Gault [CG] Formula)
secondary_outcome.description: Change (mL/min) from baseline in actual GFR (using Cockcroft-Gault [CG] formula) after 9 months (or 40 weeks) of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change From Baseline in Actual GFR (Using Abbreviated MDRD Formula)
secondary_outcome.description: Change (mL/min) from baseline in actual GFR (abbreviated MDRD formula using the patient's actual body surface area) after 9 months (or 40 weeks) of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change From Baseline in Actual GFR (Using CG Formula)
secondary_outcome.description: Change (mL/min) from baseline in actual GFR (CG formula using the patient's actual body surface area) after 9 months (or 40 weeks) of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Mean Serum Creatinine.
Relative Change From Baseline in Mean Serum Creatinine.
Absolute Change From Baseline in Urine Albumin-to-Creatinine Ratio.
Relative Change From Baseline in Urine Albumin-to-Creatinine Ratio.
secondary_outcome.description: The relative change from baseline in this case is positively skewed (while the absolute change is not) and the means tends to more positive values.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total 801 participants randomized. Of the randomized patients, 263 who received at least one dose of ibandronate as an injection, 263 who received at least one dose of ibandronate as an infusion and 267 patients who received at least one dose of alendronate had at least one post-baseline assessment and were included in the safety analysis.

group.title: Ibandronate 3 mg Injection
group.description: Ibandronate was administered as an intravenous (iv) injection (15 to 30 seconds) of 3 mg every 3 months.

group.title: Ibandronate 3 mg Infusion
group.description: Ibandronate was administered as an intravenous (iv) infusion (15 min) of 3 mg every 3 months.

group.title: Alendronate 70 mg Oral
group.description: Alendronate was administered as an oral tablet of 70 mg every week (Fosamax 70 mg).

group.title: Ibandronate 3 mg Injection
group.description: Ibandronate was administered as an intravenous (iv) injection (15 to 30 seconds) of 3 mg every 3 months.

group.title: Alendronate 70 mg Oral
group.description: Alendronate was administered as an oral tablet of 70 mg every week (Fosamax 70 mg).

reported_events.time_frame: AEs are considered to have occurred ‘On treatment’, defined as first dose and up 106 days after last dose if patient’s actual treatment is ibandronate, or up to 22 days after last dose if patient’s actual treatment is the alendronate.

group.title: Ibandronate 3 mg Injection
group.description: Ibandronate was administered as an intravenous (iv) injection (15 to 30 seconds) of 3 mg every 3 months.

group.description: Alendronate was administered as an oral tablet of 70 mg every week (Fosamax 70 mg).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
